Boston.com
10

Ameridose to lay off 650 in wake of meningitis outbreak

The layoff affects Ameridose, a major supplier of injectable drugs to hospitals nationwide, and 140 workers at its affiliated marketing company. (Globe)
  • 11/2 Closure of Ameridose extended 2 weeks
  • 10/10 Ameridose faced previous safety questions

Kayak to be bought for $1.8 billion

The travel search company with offices in Concord and Norwalk, Conn., is being acquired by Priceline.com for $1.8 billion in cash and stock. (Boston Globe)
  • 7/21 Kayak rises in Wall Street debut  |  Company profile

With a new ski season comes a number of improvements and additions all across New England.

Warren cites discretion for terseness

"All I can say is I was a lot more discreet as a candidate than I was in real life," Senator-elect Elizabeth Warren told reporters after a press conference. Discuss
Video | Warren faces challenge in win

Officials: Iran fired on US drone over Gulf

An Iranian aircraft fired at least twice at an unarmed drone conducting routine surveillance in international airspace, the Pentagon said today. (AP)

Car fire snarls traffic on I-93S

The fire near Savin Hill backed up highway traffic for the afternoon commute. (Globe)
